text.p: For each of the following lists of vectors in [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline], say whether the list spans [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline], is linearly independent, both, or neither.

choice.text: The list spans [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline] but is not linearly independent
The list is linearly independent but does not span [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline]
The list spans [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline] and is linearly independent
The list neither spans [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline] nor is linearly independent
The list spans [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline] but is not linearly independent
The list is linearly independent but does not span [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline]
The list spans [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline] and is linearly independent
The list neither spans [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline] nor is linearly independent
The list spans [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline] but is not linearly independent
The list is linearly independent but does not span [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline]
The list spans [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline] and is linearly independent
The list neither spans [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline] nor is linearly independent

font.p: In the first example, we see two vectors. Two vectors are not enough to span [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline]. A pair of vectors is linearly independent if and only if neither is a scalar multiple of the other – so we can see by inspection that this list is linearly independent.

For the other lists, we need to do more calculation. We can write the vectors as the columns of a matrix, and row-reduce. If there is a pivot in every row, we know that the vectors will span [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline], and if there is a pivot in every column, the vectors will be linearly independent. We see both when we apply this to the second list, so that list is both linearly independent and spans [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline].

For the third list, after row-reduction we obtain a [mathjaxinline]3\times 4[/mathjaxinline] matrix that only has two pivots, so this list does not span [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3,[/mathjaxinline] nor is it linearly independent. (In fact, a list of four vectors in [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline] can never be linearly independent!)
